levels.text: Ukrainian COVID-19 victims on the streets of Kyiv.

slides.text: The idea for this project came from a realization about how difficult it might be for a reader to really process the number of deaths caused by COVID-19. Graphs and tables just can‚Äôt communicate the severity of the problem or approach it from a humane position. I made a WebGL 3D simulation of Kyiv‚Äôs city center with Unity Game Engine, C# and JS. You can change the number of people, walk among them and see the crowded streets from the bird‚Äôs-eye view.

levels.text: How Kyrgyz parliament copy-pasted russian laws.

slides.text:
I scraped and analyzed all bills of the 6th Kyrgyz parliament and found that about 40% of them have similarities with Russian bills. 17 bills were almost complete copies of Russian laws.
I designed this project in Instagram-story format using JS, html, css and flourish animated charts. It was also featured in a top-10 data stories rating by GIJNüéâ.

levels.text: ‚ÄúI would have killed her anyway‚Äù. Investigation of femicide in Kyrgyzstan

slides.text: This project is a winner of the international data journalism competition The Sigma Awards 2021 üéâ. One of the main difficulties was that there are no publicly available official statistics on women‚Äôs murders. So I scraped more than 54000 criminal news articles to understand the femicide patterns in Kyrgyzstan. We identified around 80 words and sentences in accordance with femicide criteria. Then I created a Python script that converts them into flexible regex patterns to fit the complex structures of the Russian language. It let me find more than 3000 news and press releases that covered the women‚Äôs murders.

levels.text: How Kyrgyz parliamentarians change their political parties.

slides.text: Members of Kyrgyzstan‚Äôs parliament often choose their political party by how well its agenda aligns with their personal goals rather than their political values. This results in representatives frequently moving to parties that better suit their private interests, even if their agenda is opposite to their previous union‚Äôs program. I analyzed the composition of the six Kyrgyz parliaments and visualized this process using D3 and scrollytelling. This project got in top-10 data stories rating by GIJNüéâ
The first ever <mark>AR</mark>-mask in Instagram that tells a data story about gender inequality. It reached more than <mark>650k</mark> views and <mark>6200</mark> shares.

levels.text: A telegram bot for victims of domestic violence to safely ask for help.

slides.text: This telegram bot helps women to recognise signs of domestic violence, gives them information on how to protect themselves and connects them to the nearest crisis centers. My team developed bot at the UN hackathon. We have won the üèÖ1st place in the competition.

Why is it getting hotter in Bishkek - explained on heat maps.
I used raw satellite data in QGIS to calculate the surface temperature and the vegetation index.

How polluted Central Asian air is.
The first media research about air pollution in Central Asia.

How Kyrgyz parliament members violate regulations and pass laws without a quorum.
I scraped, cleaned and analyzed protocols of meetings for this investigation.
